The claim made by Gov: Chris Christie is that Assembly Democrats wanted to raise the gas tax by $2.4 billion.
The expert: s investigation found that there has been a proposal to raise the motor fuels tax by about $2.4 billion, but it has not been pushed by the Assembly Democratic leadership and stopped by the governor. The legislation has never made it to the governor's desk for any action.
State Assemblyman Albert Coutinho introd: but it has never received additional legislative sponsors or a committee hearing. The full Assembly has never voted on the proposal.
The expert also found that the bill: which Coutinho reintroduced in January, has not moved since being referred to an Assembly committee. Leadership does not seem willing to have a political conversation about it.
